sentences.english: And, dying, it rises above its own agony to outcarol the lark and the nightingale.
sentences.chinese: 它超脱了垂死的剧痛，歌声胜过百灵和夜莺。

sentences.english: He twitched like a dying fish stranded on a beach.
sentences.chinese: 他扯扯像搁浅在海滩上一个垂死的鱼。

sentences.english: It is a gift, a gift to the 22)throes of Mordor.
sentences.chinese: 这魔戒是送给垂死挣扎的魔朵的礼物。

sentences.english: We found him in the agonies of death.
sentences.chinese: 我们看到他处于垂死的痛苦之中。

sentences.english: Tasted the bitter taste of dying ambitions.
sentences.chinese: 品尝垂死的雄心那苦涩的滋味。

sentences.english: The patient nurse ministered to the dying old man.
sentences.chinese: 耐心的护士照料着那个垂死的老人。

sentences.english: writes Utsugi, a dying old man, in his diaries.
sentences.chinese: 垂死的老人Utsugi在他的日记里这样写道。

sentences.english: Can you take eggs from a dying woman?
sentences.chinese: 可以从垂死的妇女体内摘取卵子吗？

sentences.english: The dying woman panted out her last wishes .
sentences.chinese: 那个垂死的老妇人喘着气说出了她的遗愿。

sentences.english: A. Think of a dying person whose life you might save.
sentences.chinese: 想想你会挽救一个垂死病人的生命。

sentences.english: On the operating table lay a 50-year-old man, dying from heart failure.
sentences.chinese: 手术台上躺着一位因为心脏衰竭而垂死的50岁男人。

sentences.english: The enemy became more frantic in its death-bed struggle.
sentences.chinese: 敌人更加疯狂地进行垂死挣扎。

sentences.english: Alike are the groans of love to those of the dying.
sentences.chinese: 爱的呻吟与垂死者的呻呤何其相似。

sentences.english: It's not easy talking to a relative or friend who is dying.
sentences.chinese: 与垂死的亲人或朋友谈话实属不易。

sentences.english: He ended up working with the terminally and critically ill children.
sentences.chinese: 他在对那些垂死的，重病的孩子们的工作上鞠躬尽瘁。

sentences.english: The banks are now desperately scrabbling to recover their costs.
sentences.chinese: 为了弥补损失，银行现在只能垂死挣扎了。

definition: nearing death/on the point of demise/approaching extinction
to have only a breath of life (idiom)
to checkmate (in chess)/to be about to die
to cry piteously/anguished wailing/same as 哀嚎
final radiance of setting sun/fig. dying flash (of lucidity or activity, prior to demise)
to approach one's coffin (idiom); with one foot in the grave
(of animals, the wind etc) to make a mournful sound/whine/moan/wail
one's late days/to have one foot in the grave
